intro: Priotropis socotrana, commonly known as Socotra starwood, is a flowering plant endemic to the Socotra archipelago. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss. Priotropis socotrana plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is considered a symbol of the island's distinctive biodiversity.
